sub_title: Program manager Security & Justice at Cordaid
summary: I am a senior professional in Public Health, SRHR, Gender, Community based care and support, HIV&AIDS and good governance. As a medical anthropologist by profession I have experience in Africa, Asia and Latin-America.  I am an all-round,  multi-country program manager in complex and fragile contexts. An independent team worker, consultative, open, reliable with ample experience in result-oriented project & programme management and facilitation of multi-stakeholder processes.

courses.name: Integrating gender issues in development programs, Gender and Development Training Center, 1994 and 1998
Learning trajectory programmatic approach: multi-level, multi-actor process and programme planning
Management skills training: effective leadership, coaching, conflict management, negotiation and presentation skills, NCOI, 2000
PBF Performance Based Financing for Health Care, Sina Health, 2012

profile_positions.description:
Multi- country programme manager/ Alliance coordinator Jeune S3 in North - South Kivu, DRC; Cameroon, Central African Republic 

Programme, funded by the SRHR fund of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, total amount 30 million Euro (2016-2020) 

-	Responsible, as lead agency,  for effective management of the Alliance Jeune S3
-	Responsible for  annual planning and reporting of the programme in the three countries
-	Effective collaboration with the country teams, Alliance partners, steering 
        committee and  Cordaid HO team (finance, communication, advocacy, experts)
-       During the first 6 months preparation of the implementation including Multi- stakeholder        
        planning processes at country level
profile_positions.title: Alliance Coordinator Jeune S3 (Santé, Sexualité, Securité) at Cordaid

profile_positions.description:
Programme Manager Sexual Reproductive Health and Youth in Burundi, Rwanda and DRC South Kivu:

Programme, funded by the SRHR fund of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, total 
amount 30 million Euro (2013-2015)

-	Responsible, as lead agency,  for effective management of the consortium
-	Responsible for  annual planning and reporting of the programme in the three countries
-	Effective collaboration with the country teams, consortium partners, steering 
        committee and  Cordaid HO team (finance, communication, experts)
-	Contribution, as core-member of the bid team, to the proposal for strategic 
        partnership SRHR Fund of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs (track record SRH Next 
        Generation, programme and management part)
-	On-going contribution to the full proposal including budget, after approval of the 
        programme  (2016- 2020), total amount 30 million Euros
profile_positions.title: Multi- country programme Manager SRH Next Generation Programme

profile_positions.description:
Responbile for Health and Social Wellbeing Programme in Ethiopia and Cameroon

-	Responsible for realizing program results with partner organizations with regards to 
        SRH& HIV&AIDS, Health Systems Strengthening (PBF) and Community Care, with             
        focus on women, youth and children through strategic financing and capacity building
-	Responsible for acquisition of funding; planning, monitoring and evaluation of projects and 
        programmes 
- 	Responsible for development of international networks directed to change power relations and   
        for establishing efficient and effective relationship with the field office in Ethiopia
profile_positions.title: Programme Responsible Health Care and Social Wellbeing

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for connection between stakeholders and partner networks in North and South 
in close collaboration with the regional offices. Responsible for connection between 
implementation and thematic knowledge that has been build up in programs

Provide advice and facilitate processes of global as well as regional program development and implementation (thematic advice and on key principles).

-	Responsible for strategic funding of global health and HIV programs and partner organizations which includes assessment, financing and monitoring of activities
-	Contribute to policy development and annual planning and reporting at corporate and regional level 
-	Maintain and strengthen relations with (inter)national strategic partners, alliances and networks
-	Support linking and learning within and between programs in the regions and on global level and stimulation of innovation
-	Contribute to communication and fundraising for regional and global programs
profile_positions.title: Global Program Coordinator Health and HIV&AIDS

profile_positions.description:
2007-2009     Program Officer India basic health care and SRH&R, HIV & AIDS, Gender and Children at Risk:
Responsible for multi-actor and multi-level program development and coordination between  ICCO and partners/ program coalitions. Identification and facilitation of  program coalitions by applying the 4 ICCO strategic roles in the programmatic approach: strategic financing, lobby& advocacy, capacity building and brokerage.
Responsible for efficient and effective management of partner relations as follows: 
-	Project and program cycle management and facilitation
-	Assessment of program and project proposals on content and budget
-	Control, evaluation and monitoring of ongoing contracts between ICCO and local partners
-	Contribution to policy development, annual plan formulation in thematic working group (HIV&AIDS, basic health care) and regional team 
-	Transfer of partner relations to the newly established regional office of South Asia in New Delhi (accomplished at the end of 2009)

January – June 2010     Program Officer Latin America:
Mainly involved in handing over of the  food security program in Bolivia to the Regional Office and responsible for management of relationships with worldwide program and partner organizations related to Health and HIV&AIDS
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the coordination of the formulation of a DGIS funded HIV & AIDS program  proposal in South Asia (3 countries) and Africa (5 countries). Subsequently responsible for the grant management of that funded program (TMF 2006-2010) and further private fundraising for various activities (PSO, private sector, private funds, regional funding)

-	Identification and formulation of projects directed to capacity building of partner organizations in the south and public engagement, lobby & advocacy in the north
-	Identification and support of public- private partnerships
-	Responsible for financial monitoring and management of the program
-	Contribution to policy development of VSO NL (strategy plan) and formulation, implementation and monitoring of annual plan of programs department
profile_positions.title: Program Coordinator HIV&AIDS South Asia and East-Southern Africa

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for  setting up, development, implementation and supervision of a new programme of SNV Peru in a marginalized region due to the civil war between the Government and Shining Path on strengthening of good governance, gender, sustainable economic development, sustainable management of natural resources. 

-	Policy and (multi)- annual plan formulation and monitoring of the implementation of the program including budget delegation
-	Identification and formulation of new and follow-up activities based on the needs of the target population and partner- organizations within the policy framework
-	Coaching of a team of SNV advisors and support staff (15 persons) 
-	Responsible for the financial, administrative and logistical issues in the regional office
profile_positions.title: Regional Programme Coordinator Southern Andes Peru

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the development of a program in the field of strengthening of local governance, food security, organizational strengthening, community development and gender in Western Zambia.  
Responsible for setting up and running a regional office including policy development, policy implementation, coaching of personnel, administration and logistics based on integral, consultative, results based management. 

-	Policy and (multi)- annual plan formulation and monitoring of the implementation of the program including budget delegation
-	Identification and formulation of new and follow-up activities based on the needs of the target population and partner- organizations within the policy framework
-	Coaching of a team of SNV advisors and support staff of (10 persons)
-	Responsible for the financial, administrative,  and logistical issues in the regional office
profile_positions.title: Regional Program Coordinator Western Province in Zambia

profile_positions.description:
1991- 1994   Junior technical officer at WHO Bhutan in Thimphu, Bhutan:
Responsible for the collaboration with the concerned national authorities in planning, management, budgeting, financing, implementation, monitoring, reporting and the related correspondences of primary health care programmes. 

1989 -1991  Junior expert, Information, Education and Communication (IEC) advisory team on labour  and population at ILO Kenya in Nairobi funded by UNFPA:                                       
Responsible for the backstopping of activities of on-going projects on income-generation and sexual and reproductive health and rights, especially of the Mathare Valley slum project in Nairobi.
profile_positions.title: Junior programme officer
